parameters.name: GrowthType
parameters.description: The algorithm used to define how percentage grows over time. AppConfig supports the following growth types: Linear: For this type, AppConfig processes the deployment by increments of the growth factor evenly distributed over the deployment time. For example, a linear deployment that uses a growth factor of 20 initially makes the configuration available to 20 percent of the targets. After 1/5th of the deployment time has passed, the system updates the percentage to 40 percent. This continues until 100% of the targets are set to receive the deployed configuration. Exponential: For this type, AppConfig processes the deployment exponentially using the following formula: G*(2^N). In this formula, G is the growth factor specified by the user and N is the number of steps until the configuration is deployed to all targets. For example, if you specify a growth factor of 2, then the system rolls out the configuration as follows: 2*(2^0) 2*(2^1) 2*(2^2) Expressed numerically, the deployment rolls out as follows: 2% of the targets, 4% of the targets, 8% of the targets, and continues until the configuration has been deployed to all targets.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the deployment strategy.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the deployment strategy.

nested_items.name: DeploymentDurationInMinutes
nested_items.description: Total amount of time the deployment lasted.

nested_items.name: GrowthType
nested_items.description: The algorithm used to define how percentage grew over time.

nested_items.name: GrowthFactor
nested_items.description: The percentage of targets that received a deployed configuration during each interval.

nested_items.name: FinalBakeTimeInMinutes
nested_items.description: The amount of time that AppConfig monitored for alarms before considering the deployment to be complete and no longer eligible for automatic rollback.

nested_items.name: ReplicateTo
nested_items.description: Save the deployment strategy to a Systems Manager (SSM) document.
